Package in.co.rays.proj4.model

Class UserModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • in.co.rays.proj4.model.UserModel
  • public class UserModel
extends java.lang.Object
    UserModel handles all database operations related to User entity such as add, update, delete, find, authenticate, etc. This class uses JDBC for interaction with the database and supports operations like registration, password change, and password recovery.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Chaitanya Bhatt

      • add

        public long add​(UserBean bean)
         throws ApplicationException,
                DuplicateRecordException
        Adds a new User to the database.
        Parameters:
        bean - the UserBean containing user details
        Returns:
        primary key of the newly added user
        Throws:
        ApplicationException - if an application-level exception occurs
        DuplicateRecordException - if the login ID already exists

      • update

        public void update​(UserBean bean)
            throws DuplicateRecordException,
                   ApplicationException
        Updates an existing user in the database.
        Parameters:
        bean - the UserBean containing updated user details
        Throws:
        DuplicateRecordException - if the login ID already exists for another user
        ApplicationException - if an application-level exception occurs

      • changePassword

        public boolean changePassword​(java.lang.Long id,
                              java.lang.String oldPassword,
                              java.lang.String newPassword)
                       throws RecordNotFoundException,
                              ApplicationException
        Changes the password of a user.
        Parameters:
        id - the user ID
        oldPassword - the current password
        newPassword - the new password
        Returns:
        true if password changed successfully, false otherwise
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - if old password is invalid
        ApplicationException - if an application-level exception occurs

      • forgetPassword

        public boolean forgetPassword​(java.lang.String login)
                       throws RecordNotFoundException,
                              ApplicationException
        Sends a password to the user's email for password recovery.
        Parameters:
        login - the login ID (email)
        Returns:
        true if email sent successfully
        Throws:
        RecordNotFoundException - if login ID does not exist
        ApplicationException - if an application-level exception occurs

                  throws DuplicateRecordException,

        Parameters:
        bean - the UserBean containing user details
        Returns:
        primary key of the newly registered user
        Throws:
        DuplicateRecordException - if login ID already exists
        ApplicationException - if an application-level exception occurs
